message_1: A sample of 50 students has a mean height of 1.68 meters and a standard deviation of 0.08 meters. What is the 90% confidence interval for the true mean height of all students in the school?
message_2:
To calculate the 90% confidence interval for the true mean height of all students in the school, we will use the formula:

CI = x̄ ± (t * (s / √n))

where:
CI = confidence interval
x̄ = sample mean (1.68 meters)
t = t-score (which we will find using the t-distribution table)
s = sample standard deviation (0.08 meters)
n = sample size (50 students)

Since we are looking for a 90% confidence interval, we will have 5% in each tail of the distribution (100% - 90% = 10%, and half of that is 5%). With 49 degrees of freedom (n - 1 = 50 - 1 = 49), we can find the t-score from a t-distribution table or using a calculator. The t-score for a 90% confidence interval with 49 degrees of freedom is approximately 1.676.

Now, we can plug the values into the formula:

CI = 1.68 ± (1.676 * (0.08 / √50))

CI = 1.68 ± (1.676 * (0.08 / 7.071))

CI = 1.68 ± (1.676 * 0.0113)

CI = 1.68 ± 0.0189

The 90% confidence interval for the true mean height of all students in the school is approximately (1.6611, 1.6989) meters.
